content.title: Femoral Aneurysm
content.definition: True CFA aneurysm (>1.5cm) vs anastomotic pseudoaneurysm. 70% have other aneurysms. Repair if symptomatic or >2.5cm.
content.statement: Femoral Aneurysm is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Aneurysms that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Femoral Aneurysm helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Femoral Aneurysm include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Femoral Aneurysm.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
